source:
<class name="GaussianFitter" extends="CurveFitter" startLine="31">
* Fits points to a {@link org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.function.Gaussian.Parametric Gaussian} function. *
* Usage example: * * GaussianFitter fitter = new GaussianFitter( * new LevenbergMarquardtOptimizer()); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.0254623, 531026.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.03128248, 984167.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.03839603, 1887233.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.04421621, 2687152.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.05132976, 3461228.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.05326982, 3580526.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.05779662, 3439750.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.0636168, 2877648.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.06943698, 2175960.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.07525716, 1447024.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.08237071, 717104.0); * fitter.addObservedPoint(4.08366408, 620014.0); * double[] parameters = fitter.fit(); * 2.2 $Id: GaussianFitter.java 1416643 2012-12-03 19:37:14Z tn $
* Constructs an instance using the specified optimizer. optimizer Optimizer to use for the fitting.
* Fits a Gaussian function to the observed points. initialGuess First guess values in the following order: * *
Norm *
Mean *
Sigma * the parameters of the Gaussian function that best fits the * observed points (in the same order as above). 3.0
NOPMD
Do nothing.
NOPMD
Do nothing.
* Fits a Gaussian function to the observed points. the parameters of the Gaussian function that best fits the * observed points (in the same order as above).
* Guesses the parameters {@code norm}, {@code mean}, and {@code sigma}of a {@link org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.function.Gaussian.Parametric}based on the specified observed points.
* Normalization factor.
* Mean.
* Standard deviation.
* Constructs instance with the specified observed points. observations Observed points from which to guess the * parameters of the Gaussian. NullArgumentException if {@code observations} is{@code null}. NumberIsTooSmallException if there are less than 3 * observations.
* Gets an estimation of the parameters. the guessed parameters, in the following order: * *
Normalization factor *
Mean *
Standard deviation *
* Sort the observations. unsorted Input observations. the input observations, sorted.
<declaration type="Comparator" name="cmp" />
* Guesses the parameters based on the specified observed points. points Observed points, sorted. the guessed parameters (normalization factor, mean and * sigma).
TODO: Exceptions should not be used for flow control.
* Finds index of point in specified points with the largest Y. points Points to search. the index in specified points array.
* Interpolates using the specified points to determine X at the * specified Y. points Points to use for interpolation. startIdx Index within points from which to start the search for * interpolation bounds points. idxStep Index step for searching interpolation bounds points. y Y value for which X should be determined. the value of X for the specified Y. ZeroException if {@code idxStep} is 0. OutOfRangeException if specified {@code y} is not within the * range of the specified {@code points}.
* Gets the two bounding interpolation points from the specified points * suitable for determining X at the specified Y. points Points to use for interpolation. startIdx Index within points from which to start search for * interpolation bounds points. idxStep Index step for search for interpolation bounds points. y Y value for which X should be determined. the array containing two points suitable for determining X at * the specified Y. ZeroException if {@code idxStep} is 0. OutOfRangeException if specified {@code y} is not within the * range of the specified {@code points}.
Boundaries are replaced by dummy values because the raised exception is caught and the message never displayed. TODO: Exceptions should not be used for flow control.
* Determines whether a value is between two other values. value Value to test whether it is between {@code boundary1}and {@code boundary2}. boundary1 One end of the range. boundary2 Other end of the range. {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code boundary1} and{@code boundary2} (inclusive), {@code false} otherwise.
